# Compare values of outputs at specfied time-points between two simulations.
# -compareX <list / range of times>
-compareX "1e-09,2e-09,3e-09,4e-09,5e-09"
-compareX "1e-09:1e-09:5e-09" 
# Compare times at which output crosses specified value between two simulations
# -compareY <list of cross points>
# Time for the circuit to settle after some kick start. Comparisons wont be done for <val> amount of time from time 0. Default: 0
-settlingTime <val> (optional)
-delay <val> (optional)
<val> is the amount of shift that will be applied to output before doing any comparisons. Default:0
-absTol <val> (optional)
Absolute Tolerance for  differences between outputs from two simulations
-relTol <val> (optional)
Relative tolerance for differences between outputs from two simulations





# config file example:
ALIAS arf addr_valid
ALIAS tx TXitermcontrolSnnnH[8:0]
ALIAS cx CompDoneSnnnL
ALIAS hier pcie_te/gio/giopci
ALIAS hier2 giopcicomc/giopci_comp//
ALIAS hier1 edram_te/edram/opio/opiocgu/

#Example of Event Sequence - spec is a range - Use : operator
EvtSeq <hier1/arf,fall> <hier1/arf,rise>
Spec <hier1/arf,.5,hier1/arf,.1:.15> <hier1/afr,1>

#Example of Event Sequence - spec is range for a bus 
EvtSeq <hier/hier2/cx,rise>
Spec <hier/hier2/tx,0x88:0x97,hier/hier2/TXitermcontrolSnnnH[5],1>

#Example of measurement with spec
edram_te/edram/opio/opiocgu/anaobs_edpll_a,edram_te/edram/opio/opiocgu/anaobs_edpll_a,edram_te/edram/opio/opiocgu/anaobs_edpll_a -meas max,min -settlingTime 100e-09 -probe V -spec 1,0:2
edram_te/edram/opio/opiocgu/anaobs_edpll_a,edram_te/edram/opio/opiocgu/anaobs_edpll_a,edram_te/edram/opio/opiocgu/anaobs_edpll_a -meas max,min -settlingTime 100e-09 -probe V -spec 0.85:2,0
